title: 1965 RHD 11 Window Devon, Adjustable Suspension, Good 1600cc, Disc Brakes

posts.content:
Solid Patina 1965 RHD Devon for sale -

Only selling as I've seen something else I'd like.
Priced to go at Â£25,000



11 Window original Devon Interior.
Bottom 12" restored all round a few years ago, by a previous owner.
Replaced - Inner & Outer sills both sides, bottom of the nose, rear corners, floor sections etc.
Has been taken back to original paint where possible, the rest has been blended in with 2K Acrylic.
Essentially a daily driver; my only vehicle - It has been incredibly reliable.
It gets tucked away in an enclosed car port.
Solid underneath
MOTd in July with only a couple of advisories.





Suspension and running gear -

4" Narrowed & Adjustable front beam with dropped spindles.
Steering rack conversion
Straight axle conversion at the rear, with T2D adjustable spring plates.
Dual circuit brakes with Porsche 944 discs up front.
Trailer Queen Restos 32mm tubs.
Genuine Porsche Teledial wheels, 6" wide at the front and 7" wide at the back.



Front Safaris with Monkey Dub seals which let in very little moisture (It's a daily driver and it genuinely doesn't let a lot of moisture in).



Engine -
1600cc engine
Genuine 34 Pict-3 carburettor, original 1600cc manifold, and new end castings.
Fuel lines regularly checked, replaced in May-June this year with the correct grade R9 hose.
Electronic fuel pump, Malpassi filter king fuel pressure regulator (They have been moved to more suitable locations since the below photo).
Pre-1964 vacuum advance dizzy installed; mostly for looks, but it drives superbly and pulls really well up hills.




Interior -
Original Devon interior, unrestored (wood). The cushions are a later addition, which I don't think are original Devon items as they aren't Duracour.
Contains the original Devon shaving mirror, magazine rack, (soon to be back in the bus) Easycolyte, Easicool fridge and Dudley cooker. It's missing the Whale pump unfortunately.
A few people have commented how complete and good the interior is considering it is unrestored.














Billet aluminum drinks holder (AAC)
Nice original steering wheel


Bad bits : Paint is obviously tatty. When I stripped the bus to find the original paint I tried to remove all of the unnecessary filler; I preferred the exposed dents than inches of filler. I reduced the amount of filler around all the old repairs and tidied it up. There are dents around the bus, and the lower nose looks to have a fair bit of filler over the repairs; again I reduced the amount there, but didn't dig very deep. Bottom of the inner arches are crusty. Bottom of the doors are crusty. Drops a little oil from the gearbox and engine but not loads.

During my ownership of the van I have tried to improve the bus with every job I've done; either aesthetically or in function. It has had a great deal of time and money spent in the process.

Based in Nuneaton, Warwickshire.
Hello mate is the bus still for sale.
It is still available
The vehicle I was interested in has now sold, so I'm going to keep my bus a bit longer.
